title: Ticket #11: condor_q -run -format produces broken output
description:
"condor_status -run -format ..." works as you might expect, it prints out your special format for all machines with running jobs. Great.

"condor_q -run -format ..." prints out a mixture of "condor_q -run" output and "condor_q -constraint 'JobStatus==2' -format ..." output. Not great.

Is this intended, or should it be fixed? There is a clear workaround, use "condor_q -constraint 'JobStatus==2' -format ...", but that's onerous. This also happens with -hold, -goodput, and -io.

See also #399 which may be a dupe.

2011-Nov-04 12:41:42 by adesmet:
Content of #399, which is basically a dupe:

condor_q -run -format produces odd output.

condor_q -run works as expected: 

% condor_q -run | head

-- Submitter: ribera.cs.wisc.edu : <128.105.166.16:34160> : ribera.cs.wisc.edu
 ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME HOST(S)
1507.2   pdudnik         4/10 09:31   9+00:22:36 slot1@s1-23.cs.wisc.edu
1507.6   pdudnik         4/10 09:31   9+00:22:57 slot2@s1-23.cs.wisc.edu
1508.2   pdudnik         4/10 09:31   9+00:22:52 slot2@s1-28.cs.wisc.edu
1510.2   pdudnik         4/10 09:32   6+11:58:41 slot1@s1-27.cs.wisc.edu
1510.5   pdudnik         4/10 09:32   8+18:52:57 slot3@clover-17.cs.wisc.edu
1510.6   pdudnik         4/10 09:32   6+12:18:38 slot2@s1-29.cs.wisc.edu

condor_q -format works as expected: 

% condor_q -format '%s ' RemoteHost -format '%s\n' ImageSize -const 'JobStatus==2' | head
slot2@s0-06.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
slot2@s0-11.cs.wisc.edu 1000000
slot1@clover-29.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
slot3@clover-29.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
slot2@s1-14.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
slot1@s0-26.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
slot1@clover-22.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
slot3@clover-18.cs.wisc.edu 1200000
slot2@clover-22.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
slot1@clover-12.cs.wisc.edu 1200000

Both together partially works, but adds lines of [????]: 

% condor_q -run -format '%s ' RemoteHost -format '%s\n' ImageSize | head
slot2@s0-06.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
[????????????]  [????????????] [??????????] [????????????????]
slot3@clover-29.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
[????????????]  [????????????] [??????????] [????????????????]
slot2@s1-14.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
[????????????]  [????????????] [??????????] [????????????????]
slot3@clover-18.cs.wisc.edu 1200000
[????????????]  [????????????] [??????????] [????????????????]
slot2@clover-22.cs.wisc.edu 1100000
[????????????]  [????????????] [??????????] [????????????????]

Expected behavior: No lines full of brackets and question marks; essentially the same output if I replace "-run" with "-const JobStatus==2".

2011-Nov-04 12:43:59 by adesmet:
Zaniness also happens with -hold. 

[root@submit squid]# condor_q -hold qpei -format '%s\n' LastMatchName0
glidein_27626@c3615.local
[????????????]  [????????????] glidein_9804@c3113.local
[????????????]  [????????????] glidein_24359@c1734.local
[????????????]  [????????????]
0 jobs; 0 idle, 0 running, 0 held
[root@submit squid]# condor_q -format '%s\n' LastMatchName0 -hold qpei
glidein_27626@c3615.local
[????????????]  11/4  12:41 The job attribute OnExitHold expression 'Ex
glidein_9804@c3113.local
[????????????]  11/4  12:42 The job attribute OnExitHold expression 'Ex
glidein_24359@c1734.local
[????????????]  11/4  12:41 The job attribute OnExitHold expression 'Ex

0 jobs; 0 idle, 0 running, 0 held
[root@submit squid]# condor_q -format '%s\n' LastMatchName0 -const 'JobStatus==5' qpei
glidein_27626@c3615.local
glidein_9804@c3113.local
glidein_24359@c1734.local

Expected behavior: all three of the above would return identical answers, with the last one being correct.

2011-Nov-04 12:46:08 by adesmet:
General proposal: -run, -hold, and -globus do two things:

  1. Select a subset of jobs (-run means JobStatus==2. -hold means JobStatus==5)
  2. Produce a special report.

If one of these options is present, and a -format option is present, we keep the subsetting, but discard the special report in favor of the -format.

The general logic needs an overhaul to remove the problem where order of seemingly unrelated arguments matters.

2016-Jan-28 15:18:17 by johnkn:
as of 8.5.2, condor_q has been substantially re-written so that -run and -hold will now only constrain the query when used with one of the other formatting options. so 

    condor_q -run -af clusterid

will return only running cluster id's of running jobs, etc.
